Definition: Operator that evaluates the function name on the left-hand-side (LHS) of the opening parentheses using the arguments enclosed by the parentheses
Infix operator that assigns an object on the right-hand-side (RHS) to a name on the left-hand-side (LHS) -- this should not be used for global assignments!
The formula operator separates the left- and right-hand sides (LHS and RHS) in a formula.
Infix operator that generates a regular sequence of adjacent values
Extraction operator used to index multiple values from a data object (LHS) based on the position or values specified inside the brackets
Infix arithmetic operator (subtract) or prefix negative symbol operator
Infix arithmetic operator (divide)
Infix arithmetic operator (to the power of)
Transform an atomic vector to a character vector
Transform an atomic vector to an double numeric vector (i.e., decimal numbers)
Print the class of an object as a one-value character vector
Attach the package environment for a given package to the current R session
Assign the items in a list to a specified environment
Print a one-value character vector that represents how a data object is stored on our computer
Combine rows of two or more tibbles to create a new tibble
Subset a data frame by logical condition
Add or modify a column in a data frame
Extract a column from a data frame as a vector
Convert properly formatted date, stored as a character or datetime vector, to a date class object
Convert a date formatted as day, month, year (European date format) to a date class object
Get hour-of-day from an ISO-8601 formatted object with a date and time.
Convert a date formatted as month, day, year (US date format) to a date class object
Extract the month from a properly formatted date value
Extract the day of the week from a properly formatted date value
Calculate the day of year from a properly formatted date object
Extract the year from a properly formatted date value
Generate a date-time class object with an character vector of the format yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss
The pipe operator passes the output of the LHS argument to the function on the right
Read an RDS file into R
Logical test of whether a pattern (string) is contained within a character value
Row-wise creation of a tibble data frame
Combine columns in a data frame to create a single column
